intro: Verbascum formosum, commonly known as the showy mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Verbascum formosum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
